column4: Is it possible that installing ubuntu on a slave drive (ide) with a cd-rom as primary, could cause some weird problems?
i don'r see how it would cause any problem
ok, im trying to figure out what i've done ;)
because i cant close my cd-tray anymore and grub isn't working. just installed ubuntu for the first time ;)
weird,  i did that  with another distro  while i was running windows and it worked fine,
i think it's maybesomething with that, and the fact that i've got a lot of ide/sata disc in a nice mix ;)
umm true,  have you though about making ur secondry  slave the master slave  and the cdrom  the secondry slave
yeah, just hope i could work around it. but now i cant boot ubuntu at all ;)
so nothing changes except my cd readers all screwd up ;)
yikes  that bad  hmmm  try  switching the  cabels  you might have to reinstall grub  someone  here might have another suggestion
jaminpotato:  they are releasing edgy  that early  in the game>
yeah guess i'll have to mix it up a little. that's why i asked about the install prompting grub stuff, because it all seemed to happen so fast and automagic
i know what you mean  on that one,  umm
i just hope i dont destroy my windows-install because then im screwd too ;)
umm you can boot of your windows xp disk  and  go to the repair consol and type fdisk .mbr  and that will make it back to the default  ms config
oh, i didnt know that, thanks
that ok,  just keep trying  to  install  ubuntu
